--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "kelvsyc" <kelvsyc@...> wrote:
>
> I've just =
gotten into parameterized testing and customized JUnit4
> Runners, but I ha=
ve a few questions:
> 
> How do I go about making a parameterized test for =
which a single
> default parameter value is provided if a list of parameter=
 values is
> not given?  (It appears to me that you may need to have a cust=
om
> runner that's similar to Parameterized)
> 
> Furthermore, suppose I ha=
ve a subclass of this test, which defines a
> second parameter, which, unli=
ke the first, is a required parameter
> (ie. I can choose to have my list o=
f parameters as either two values
> or a single, which would assume the usa=
ge of a default value).  How
> would I go about doing that?  (Would I need =
to use a different runner?)
> 
> How would I generalize this to any number =
of parameters (required and
> optional)?
> 

What Parameterized runner does=
 it takes a Collection that returns by
@Parameterized method run over it, f=
or each Object[] calls constructor
of your class with supplied variables (t=
hat initialize data-members
that will be used by your test method) and call=
s test method. The
naive way to handle it is to define couple of constructo=
r that will
call one to another and supplying default values. For each entr=
y in
Collecion appropriate constructor will be called. It is nice, but
unfo=
rtunately is not working. It happens that Parameterized runner
enforce you =
to have only one constructor. Under these circumstances
your question is eq=
uivalent how can you supplied default values to the
attribute in the functi=
on (constructor in your case). In Java there is
no way to do it (other then=
 overloading). So there is no way out for
now, at least as far as I know.

=
> Finally, what if I wanted my parameterized tests to be named via some
> n=
aming function (instead of serially numbered like Parameterized)?
>

Parame=
terized runner is written is such a way that there is no easy to
extend it =
in order to achieve this. The main obstacle is that you
can't override "new=
 TestClassRunnerForParameters(...)" in private
static runners method, so yo=
u actually hast to rewrite this class
completely.
